text: Afterward Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and said, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said, ‘Release my people so that they may hold a pilgrim feast to me in the wilderness.’”
But Pharaoh said, “Who is the Lord that I should obey him by releasing Israel? I do not know the Lord, and I will not release Israel!”

And they said, “The God of the Hebrews has met with us. Let us go a three-day journey into the wilderness so that we may sacrifice to the Lord our God, so that he does not strike us with plague or the sword.”

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them, “<st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> and <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st>, <st data-num="04100" class="">why</st> do you cause the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> to <st data-num="06544" class="">refrain</st> from their <st data-num="04639" class="">work</st>?<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01980" class="">Return</st> to your <st data-num="05450" class="">labor</st>!”
Pharaoh was thinking, “The people of the land are now many, and you are giving them rest from their labor.”
That same day Pharaoh commanded the slave masters and foremen who were over the people:

“You must <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="03254" class="">longer</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> <st data-num="08401" class="">straw</st> to the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> for <st data-num="03835" class="">making</st> <st data-num="03843" class="">bricks</st><n id="2" /> as <st data-num="08543 08032" class="">before</st>.<n id="3" /> Let <st data-num="01992" class="">them</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st><n id="4" /> and <st data-num="07197" class="">collect</st> <st data-num="08401" class="">straw</st> for themselves.

But you must <st data-num="07760" class="">require</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">of</st> them the same <st data-num="04971" class="">quota</st> of <st data-num="03843" class="">bricks</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> were <st data-num="06213" class="">making</st> <st data-num="08543 08032" class="">before</st>.<n id="2" /> Do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01639" class="">reduce</st> it, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">are</st> <st data-num="07503" class="">slackers</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03651" class="">That</st> is <st data-num="05921" class="">why</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> are <st data-num="06817" class="">crying</st>, ‘Let us <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="02076" class="">sacrifice</st> to our <st data-num="0430">God</st>.’
Make the work harder for the men so they will keep at it and pay no attention to lying words!”
So the slave masters of the people and their foremen went to the Israelites and said, “Thus says Pharaoh: ‘I am not giving you straw.

<st data-num="0859" class="">You</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">get</st> <st data-num="08401" class="">straw</st> for yourselves <st data-num="0834" class="">wherever</st> you can<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04672" class="">find</st> it, <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> there will be <st data-num="0369" class="">no</st> <st data-num="01639" class="">reduction</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">at all</st> in your <st data-num="05656" class="">workload</st>.’”

So the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="06327" class="">spread out</st><n id="1" /> through <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> to <st data-num="07197" class="">collect</st> <st data-num="07179" class="">stubble</st> for <st data-num="08401" class="">straw</st>.

The <st data-num="05065" class="">slave masters</st> were <st data-num="0213" class="">pressuring</st><n id="1" /> them, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, “<st data-num="03615" class="">Complete</st><n id="2" /> your <st data-num="04639" class="">work</st> for <st data-num="01697 03117" class="">each day</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">just like</st> when there <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="08401" class="">straw</st>!”
The Israelite foremen whom Pharaoh’s slave masters had set over them were beaten and were asked, “Why did you not complete your requirement for brickmaking as in the past—both yesterday and today?”
The Israelite foremen went and cried out to Pharaoh, “Why are you treating your servants this way?
No straw is given to your servants, but we are told, ‘Make bricks!’ Your servants are even being beaten, but the fault is with your people.”
But Pharaoh replied, “You are slackers! Slackers! That is why you are saying, ‘Let us go sacrifice to the Lord.’

So <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st>, <st data-num="01980" class="">get back</st> to <st data-num="05647" class="">work</st>!<n id="1" /> You will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> <st data-num="08401" class="">straw</st>, but you must still <st data-num="05414" class="">produce</st><n id="2" /> your <st data-num="08506" class="">quota</st><n id="3" /> of <st data-num="03843" class="">bricks</st>!”
The Israelite foremen saw that they were in trouble when they were told, “You must not reduce the daily quota of your bricks.”
When they went out from Pharaoh, they encountered Moses and Aaron standing there to meet them,
and they said to them, “May the Lord look on you and judge, because you have made us stink in the opinion of Pharaoh and his servants, so that you have given them an excuse to kill us!”
Moses returned to the Lord, and said, “Lord, why have you caused trouble for this people? Why did you ever send me?
From the time I went to speak to Pharaoh in your name, he has caused trouble for this people, and you have certainly not rescued them!”
